While working on adding some flair to the Settings/Profile, I have come up with an idea to add some colors based on the role types as a start. Since I'm new to Zulip and it's design language in general, I would really like some feedback regarding it.

I have come up with two variants for the same,

  • Variant #1: Pills
  • Variant #2: Colored texts

role_variants_dark.png

role_variants_light.png
Color coding isn’t an easy subject. Can we just use a text for now without a color?

Hmm, my concern with the settings UI has been much more about consistency and cleaning up various oddities and glitches -- I'm not sure what we can readily tackle in the design space there. One "flair"-type suggestion I think Steve Howell (showell) has made in the past is to add previews of light/dark theme. That seems a lot more manageable to me at the moment than bigger across-the-board changes.

Vlad Korobov said:

Color coding isn’t an easy subject. Can we just use a text for now without a color?

Surely. I'll leave it as text for now.

Alya Abbott said:

Hmm, my concern with the settings UI has been much more about consistency and cleaning up various oddities and glitches -- I'm not sure what we can readily tackle in the design space there. One "flair"-type suggestion I think Steve Howell (showell) has made in the past is to add previews of light/dark theme. That seems a lot more manageable to me at the moment than bigger across-the-board changes.

Okay, I'll keep this in mind and focus on those areas which you mentioned. thanks.

Here are somethings I noticed regarding the profile photo on settings/profile,

  1. The delete photo option is not the easiest to find and only appears when hovering over the top right corner.
  2. A single click on the photo leads you directly to upload the profile photo, hence making it difficult for touch screen users to delete the photo.
  3. "Upload new profile picture" and "Delete profile picture" seem a bit too long, so could we substitute it with something self explanatory like "Upload photo" and "Delete photo"

Any views on this?

Delete Profile
Deleting the profile photo (vs reuploading) is pretty rare so I don't think it's a big deal for it to be annoying on a touch screen; we have mobile apps.
And I think that sort of on-hover remove icon and on-hover upload UI is pretty common in modern apps.
So I'm not sure I'd advocate for changing any of those details.

Tim Abbott said:

And I think that sort of on-hover remove icon and on-hover upload UI is pretty common in modern apps.

Shouldn't the on-hover remove icon appear along with the "upload new profile picture" at the same time though? Currently there's a need to guess it's location by hovering on the top right.

I was working on this layout so just gonna throw it here for future reference, just in case.

Thanks for confirming, I'll work on that.

Sayam Samal said:

  1. "Upload new profile picture" and "Delete profile picture" seem a bit too long, so could we substitute it with something self explanatory like "Upload photo" and "Delete photo"

@Tim Abbott what are your views on this?
Also, @Steve Howell (showell) did you have any other ideas in your mind regarding the UI while posting the issue?

@Sayam Samal I didn't really have anything specific in mind. I like your instinct to focus on the profile picture, since that's the most visual part of the UI. Are there anything about fonts, colors, or layouts that you feel we should experiment with?

@Steve Howell (showell) there are some experimental ideas that I do have in my mind. Would like your views on those.

  1. We could separate the profile data (i.e. Role and Joined) from the mutable input data, I think this maintains the continuity between the input fields.

  2. A minor change of renaming "Profile" to "Edit your profile", since that is actually the action we are performing.

  3. (not so sure) Remove the "Profile picture" text since it's quite evident?

Here are some prototypes for the same,
fields_seperated

fields_seperated_narrow

without_profile_picture
For all these ideas I think we want to get some input from other folks, but here are my opinions...
I like your idea 1, which is to split out Role and Joined from the mutable data. As you said, it maintains continuity between the input fields, and it also seems to visually balance the page.

I like your idea 2, which is to use more of a verb-ish style call to action. I, like you, prefer "Edit your profile" to "Profile". I think this might get a little push back from folks who value conciseness here, and it's sort of obvious to users that they are going to edit. Let's see what other folks think on that.
I am pretty neutral on removing the "Profile picture" heading. I guess it is kind of redundant.

@Sayam Samal To summarize, I think we'll want to see what other folks think here. I am not the decision maker here, but as the person who filed the issue, the small tweaks that you have made here are exactly what I had in mind, so thank you for presenting some options. Keep them coming.

Due to US holidays and timezone differences, you may not get much feedback till late Tuesday.
@Steve Howell (showell) thank you for the valuable feedback, I'll be definitely waiting to hear what feedback other devs have in mind.

I think removing "Profile picture" would be a net positive, as would probably moving the role/date joined fields to live below the avatar (so they'd be at the top in a narrow window, but in that side area if not).

I don't think we should make "Profile" => "Edit your profile" in the headings; we use the same heading style for the ~25 panels of settings of naming what sort of thing you're editing, and I don't see a reason profile should be special there.
Agreed with Tim Abbott 's comments above. @Sayam Samal could you share a wide-window screenshot with the proposed changes? Thanks!

As a follow-on to Tim Abbott 's comment regarding headings, it's always a good idea to think about how proposed changes would apply to other settings panels, and comment on whether (a) they should be applied across the board, or (b) there is a good reason for the panel you're proposing to change to be different from others.
Can we get a ruling on putting Role and Joined below the profile picture? That was my favorite idea of the three.

Steve Howell (showell) said:

Can we get a ruling on putting Role and Joined below the profile picture? That was my favorite idea of the three.

Sure, I'd be happy to get a PR that does this.
@Sayam Samal fyi, in case you can to do said PR.
We should probably while we're at it move the "Role" field in your profile popover to be before the "local time" field.

Alya Abbott said:

As a follow-on to Tim Abbott 's comment regarding headings, it's always a good idea to think about how proposed changes would apply to other settings panels, and comment on whether (a) they should be applied across the board, or (b) there is a good reason for the panel you're proposing to change to be different from others.

Thank you for the insight, I'll definitely keep this in my mind when working on any future commits.

Tim Abbott said:

We should probably while we're at it move the "Role" field in your profile popover to be before the "local time" field.

I'll surely look at this too, thank you.

@Alya Abbott here is the wide-window screenshot with the proposed changes.

proposed_changes_1.png

tooltip
While working on this, one edge case that I came across is that, organizations have the option to disallow avatar changes, which is displayed with the help of a tooltip. Removing "Profile picture" leaves the tooltip hanging.
Any suggestions on how to handle this?

Here are some experiments I have made personally,

  1. Display the tooltip on hovering above the avatar itself.
  2. Display the information on the overlay.

1. avatar_tooltip

2. overlay
@Sayam Samal I think displaying on hover is the right approach; it's nice to be able to see your avatar in a normal form.
@Tim Abbott fyi, the overlay (suggestion 2) would also appear only on hover, thoughts?
@Sayam Samal yeah, that seems nice to me.

I have some other ideas in mind I would like to discuss before sending the PR.

  1. Justify the user details (role and joined) to increase the readability.
    user details justified

  2. Make the text area responsive (which improves the responsiveness of the page as well) and set a max width to prevent infinite stretching of the textarea.
    chrome_aMnaIbnxGz.gif
@Sayam Samal It might be helpful to use separate messages for these ideas, and give them a short name, such as justify-user-details, so that it's a bit easier to quote/reply or refer to them.
I am pretty neutral about the justify-user-details idea, but let's see what others think.
I like the text-area-responsive idea.

Cool, thanks @Sayam Samal -- looks nice!

Using the overlay to let the user know when replacing the profile is not allowed (instead of the upload link they'd otherwise see) looks good to me!

For the alignment for Role and Joined, could we be consistent with the full profile modal?

Screen-Shot-2022-02-28-at-4.38.57-PM.png
The text area changes look good to me... @Sahil Batra what do you think? (Also, any comments about other aspects of this thread?)
The text area change is definitely an improvement for narrow screens. Other changes also look good.
